intro: Agalmyla samarica, commonly known as the Samar Island grass, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
